successfully added gradle

added javadoc headers for all classes and methods

commitResults.messageBody: Edit code to satisfy Coding Standard

commitResults.messageTitle: Add feature to search for tasks with specific keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Ui class: Modify displayTaskList() to take in taskList and message, and display a list of tasks with the given message
Enable method to be used to print a list, given any taskList (e.g. filtered taskList)

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser class: Add header for getToExit()
Task/Deadline/ToDo/Event: change toSave to toSaveFormat Task: change toMark to mark Ui: change displayUnMarked to displayUnmarked
Add checkstyle
Add Gui for Bob
GUI: fix issue of dialog box cutting off text when it is too long, decrease image size, add padding around image
Ui: Add assertions for methods TaskList: Add assertion for getLength() method Parser: Add catch block for "mark", "unmark" and "remove" cases
commitResults.messageBody:
For methods in Ui and TaskList, the length of the task list cannot be negative.
For parser, error is thrown when index is out of bounds.

The task list should never be negative, otherwise it indicates an error in the program.
It is more user-friendly to remind the user that the index is out of bounds rather than to terminate the entire program.

Let's
* add assertions in the various methods of Ui and getLength() in TaskList to assert that length of task list has to be positive
* add catch block for "mark", "unmark" and "remove" cases of Parser, to print an error message for the user when index is out of bounds

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve Code Quality
commitResults.messageBody:
Some classes and methods lack javaDoc headers. In particular, code for the different enums in Parser class are deeply nested and hard to read and understand.

Fixing the code quality makes the code easier to read and understand for users or other future developers who may reference the code.

Let's
* add javadoc comments and headers for all class and methods
* make sure code is not too long
* create new Command classes to remove deep nesting in Parser class

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Update Command Name and date of tasks cannot be editted without deleting the task and adding a new one.
commitResults.messageBody:
Adding an update feature allows users to edit tasks without having to delete them, making it more user-friendly and convenient. It also prevents the changing of task indexs in the list, if the user arranged it intentionally.

Let's
* add a update command class
* add update methods in each task class

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Help Command
commitResults.messageBody: By entering "help", bob will reply with the full list of commands.
